### First order difference equations

$X_{t+1} = F(X_t)$

In biological population, the nonlinear function $F(x)$ often has the following propoerties.
$F(0)=0$; $F(x)$ increases monotonically as $X$ increases through the range of $0<X<A$ (with
$F(x)$ attaining its maximum value at $X=A$); $F(X)$ decreases monotonically as $X$ increases 
beyond $X=A$
$N_{t+1} = N_t(a-bN_t)$


::: {.cell}

:::
